answers.answer: The increased thirst and urination could be symptoms of diabetes. Other symptoms might be weight loss or fatigue. These things could mean diabetes or they could not; it's impossible to say without tests. I suggest seeing your doctor and getting a blood sugar test. Don't panic yet! If you do have diabetes, it is a manageable condition though it does take some work and some changes. See your doctor and let us know what happens. Don't put it off because you are worried about the results.

question: im a 20 year old man. and im hoping i dont have diabetes. but i have some symptoms, i constantly pee, i drink sodas twice as fast as other people. i heard it causes swelling of gums, and i dont have that but i have several dry spots on my gums and they are sensitive.
title: what are the odds that i have diabetes
